column4: Hello, I am running ubuntu 10.10 and was working just fine till today. Today when I started the laptop, the network manager applet is gone and also there is no network.
I try to acces my router...but it just returns can not connect to...
What seems to be the problem?
So, can anyone help me troubleshoot this issue?
Anyone?
I need some help to restart the network manager applet. Anyone ?
kill it and restart it?
Tried, not working
I can
I can't be more explicit sorry, because I am on a live cd.
but you aren currently here with ubuntu?
On the live cd I can acces my router's ip ...but when I am on my ubuntu...can't.
I am currently running a live cd...
Any suggestions ?
has your internet access ever worked? andif so, what did you change?
I have changed nothing. The current connection works on a live cd just fine
I asked about your ubuntu installation
The problem is that when I started my machine today, network manager applet was no longer in the gnome bar...and I could not acces my router from firefox which is odd.
Running 10.10 32 bit ubuntu on the machine
so check logs, the output of ifconfig, your /etc/network/interfaces, etc
Ok, I'll try. Isn't there some kind of repair of ubuntu?:)
no there is no magical repair button. next version maybe
Thanks so much :)
